titleStmt.title: Gädlä Qirqos “Vita of Cyricus” / Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus” / Mälkǝʾa Qirqos “Image of Cyricus” / Sälam-hymn for Cyricus

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

msItem.title: I. Gädlä Qirqos "Vita of Cyricus"
msItem.rubric: The names of protagonists (Qirqos and ʾIyäluṭa); names of the donors. Groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I; two initial lines on the incipit page of Texts II and III; two initial lines of each miracle in Text II; incipit of each strophe in Text III. Elements of the punctuation signs, elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 4r: በስመ፡ አብ፡ ወወልድ፡ ወመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ፩አምላክ፡ ገድል፡ ወስምዕ፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወዘእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ወዘካልአንኒ፡ ፼፲፻፵ወ፬ሰማዕታት፡ እለ፡ ተከለሉ፡ በመዋዕለ፡ እለ፡ እስክንድሮስ፡ መኰንን፨ ወኮነ፡ ስደት፡ ላዕለ፡ ኵሉ፡ አብያተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘክርስቶስ፡ ወኮነት፡ ብእሲት፡ እንተ፡ ስማ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ፈራሂተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ እምንእሳ፨ ...Fol. 4r: In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, one God, the life and the martyrdom of St. Cyricus and of his mother Julitta and of other 11,034 martyrs who were crowned during the time when the governor (was) Alexander. And there was the persecution against all the families of the Christians of Christ (all the churches) and there was a woman whose name (was) Julitta who feared God from her infancy. ...
msItem.explicit: Fol. 22va, l.6: ...ወከማሁ፡ ውእቱ፡ መምዓሊ፡ መኰንን፡ አዘዘ፡ ይዝርዉ፡ ሥጋሆሙ፨ ወመላእክተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ የዓቅቡ፡ መለያልያቲሆሙ፡ ወኵሉ፡ አመ፡ ፲ወ፭ለሠርቀ፡ ጥር፨ ወሀሎ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ በየማነ፡ መንበሩ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ ወትረ፡ ይቀውም፡ ወይተነብል፡ በእንተ፡ እለ፡ ይገብሩ፡ ኀበ፡እግዚአብሔር፡ ንጉ[fol. 22vb]ሠ፡ ስብሐት፡ ወክብር፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨Fol. 22va, l. 6: ... And again, that tyrant, the governor ordered that they scatter their corpses. And the Angels of the Lord were protecting (all) their limbs, on the 15th of the month of Ṭǝrr. And St. Cyricus stands on the right side of the throne of God, and he is always present and he intercedes for those who make (his commemoration day), in front of the Lord, King of the glory and honour. For eternity, amen.

msItem.title: II. Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus” (16 Miracles)
msItem.rubric: The names of protagonists (Qirqos and ʾIyäluṭa); names of the donors. Groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I; two initial lines on the incipit page of Texts II and III; two initial lines of each miracle in Text II; incipit of each strophe in Text III. Elements of the punctuation signs, elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 23ra (Miracle 1): በስመ፡”…ንዌጥን፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ጥንተ፡ ተአምሪሁ፡ ለብፁዕ፡ ማር፡ ቂርቆስ፡ በሰላመ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ አብ፡ አሜን፨ ወሀሎ፡፩ንጉሥ፡ ጻድቅ፡ ወካህን፡ ዘስሙ፡ ይምርሐነ፡ ክርስቶስ፡ …Fol. 23r: In the name of the Father and of the Son and of the Holy Spirit, one God, we start, with the help of the Lord, the beginning of the miracles of blessed Mar Cyricus. With the peace of the Lord, Father, amen. And there was a King, righteous and priest, whose name was Yǝmrǝḥannä Krǝstos…
msItem.explicit: Fol.37ra, l.3 (Miracle 16): …ወሞተ፡ በጊዜሃ፡ ወመንፈቆሙ፡ በከዩ፡ ወመንፈቆሙ፡ ተፈሥሑ፡ እሙንቱ፡ ስብእ፨ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ ወብድረ[sic]፡ ሩፀቱ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁራኒሁ፡ ወልደ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ገብረ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ ተወልደ፡ መድኅን፡ ገብረ፡ መድኅን፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨ Fol. 37ra: And he died immediately and half of them, of those men, wept and half of them rejoiced. His prayer and his blessing and the race of his running (be) with his beloved Wäldä Yoḥannǝs, Wälättä Ṣadqan, Wäldä Maryam, Gäbrä Ḥawarya, Täwäldä Mädḫǝn, Gäbrä Mädḫǝn, for eternity, amen. ...

listBibl.bibl: (EMML II, 4; Church of St. Raphael, quarter of Guläle, Addis Abäba).
(EMML II, 364; Church of Qirqos, quarter of Boleʾ, Addis Abäba).
(EMML VIII, 283-284; Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yağğu, Wallo).
(EMML X, 324; Church of Däse Mädḫane ʿAläm, Wallo).

note.p: II-1) Fols. 23ra (l. 8) – 24rb (l. 11): St. Cyricus and King Yǝmrǝḥannä Krǝstos
(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 33-36 // mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 59v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 28vb-30rb, GrébGriaule II, 4).
II-2) Fols. 24rb (l. 12) – 25ra (l. 19): St. Cyricus and St. George of Lydda.
II-3) Fols. 25rb (l. 1) – 26va (l. 11): St. Cyricus and the blind man who loved the fighting and the quarrel.
II-4) Fols. 26va (l. 12) – 27rb (l. 3): St. Cyricus and the infidel man.
II-5) Fols. 27rb (l. 4) – 27vb (l. 17): St. Cyricus and the guardian of the church of St. Cyriacus, in the region of May Ḍaʿada.
II-6) Fols. 27vb (l. 18) – 28vb (l. 15): St. Cyricus and the farmer who wanted to repair the tie-hook (qäraqǝro) of the yoke.
II-7) Fols. 28vb (l. 16) – 30ra (l. 14): St. Cyricus and the evil man.
II-8) Fols. 30ra (l. 15) – 31ra (l. 15): St. Cyricus and the faithful men of Qälma.
II-9) Fols. 31ra (l. 16) – 31vb (l. 2): St. Cyricus and the adulteress.
II-10) Fols. 31vb (l. 3) – 32rb (l. 7): St. Cyricus and the ruler who built other churches dedicated to him.
II-11) Fols. 32rb (l. 8) – 33ra (l. 4): St. Cyricus, learned priests of his church and a hermit.
II-12) Fols. 33ra (l. 5) – 33va (l. 17): St. Cyricus receiving his kidan on 15 Ṭǝrr.
II-13) Fols. 33va (l. 18) – 34rb (l. 19): St. Cyricus and the man of bad behavior.
II-14) Fols. 34va (l. 1) – 35ra (l. 16): St. Cyricus and St. Gäbrǝʾel.
II-15) Fols. 35ra (l. 16) – 36ra (l. 8): St. Cyricus and the monk ʾElyas

(S. Grébaut, “Un noveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 87-90 // mss. EMML no. 3469, fol. 22r, EMML VIII, 283; EMML no. 4816, fol. 62v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 32vb-33vb, GrébGriaule II, 5).
II-16) Fols. 36ra (l. 9) – 37ra (l. 12): St. Cyricus and the thief who stole cloths and was punished.
(S. Grébaut, “Les miracles du saint enfant Cyriaque”, ROC 20 (1915-1917),129-132// ms. EMML no. 3469, fol. 25r, EMML VIII, 283).

msItem.title: III. Mälkǝʾa Qirqos “Images of Cyricus” (42 strophes)
msItem.rubric: The names of protagonists (Qirqos and ʾIyäluṭa); names of the donors. Groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I; two initial lines on the incipit page of Texts II and III; two initial lines of each miracle in Text II; incipit of each strophe in Text III. Elements of the punctuation signs, elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 37ra, l.14: ኦክርስቶስ፡ ናዝራዊ፡ ዘተወከፍከ፡ ሕማመ። ፀሐይ፡ ብሩህ፡ ወጽዱል፡ እስከ፡ ሡራሔሁ፡ አጽለመ፨ መጽሐፈ፡ ዜናሁ፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ መንፈሳዊ፡ ወዘመልክዑ፡ ሰላመ፨ ጸሐፍ፡ ውስተ፡ ልብየ፡ እንዘ፡ ትገብር፡ ቀለመ። ደመከ፡ አምላካዊ፡ በመስቀል፡ ዘዘንመ፨ …Fol. 37ra, l.14: O Christ hermit, who have received the passion. Sun shining and brilliant so much so that His glory darkened. The book of the story of the spiritual Cyricus and of his image, salutation. Description in my hearth while you are making the color. Your divine blood which has rained by means of the Cross. …
msItem.explicit: Fol. 41vb, l.18: …ኦአምላከ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወዘእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ዕቀበነ፡ ወአድኅነነ፡ ሠውረነ፡ ወባልሐነ፡ እምኵሉ፡ ዘመነ፡ ም[fol. 42ra]ንሳዊ፡ ወእምዕለት፡ እኪት፡ ለሰብአ፡ ዛቲ፡ መቅደስ፨ ዐቢይ፡ ወንዑስ፨ ወፈድፋደስ፡ ለፍቁራኒከ፨ ወልደ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወብእሲቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ወወልዶሙ፡ ገብ[sic]፡ ጊዮርጊስ።Fol. 41vb, l.18: …O God of saint Cyricus and of his mother Julitta, protect us and save us, hide us and liberate us from every moment of temptation and from the daily vice, the persons of this important and small sanctuary, and especially your beloved ones, Wäldä Yoḥannǝs and his wife Wälättä Ṣadǝqan and their son Gäbrä Giyorgis.

listBibl.bibl: EMML no. 486 (late 19th or early 20th, Church of Qirqos, quarter of Bole, ʾAddis ʾAbäba),

msItem.title: IV. Sälam-hymn for Cyricus
msItem.rubric: The names of protagonists (Qirqos and ʾIyäluṭa); names of the donors. Groups of lines on the incipit page of Text I; two initial lines on the incipit page of Texts II and III; two initial lines of each miracle in Text II; incipit of each strophe in Text III. Elements of the punctuation signs, elements of Ethiopic numerals.
msItem.incipit: Fol. 42ra, l.7: ሰላም፡ ለከ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሕፃን። መዓድመ፡ መልክዕ፡ ወስን፨ ዘኢያፍርሐከ፡ ትግርምተ፡ ዕልዋን፨ …Fol. 42ra, l.7: Salutation to you, infant Cyricus. Pleasing of image and beauty, whom the terror of the heretics does not terrified. ...
msItem.explicit: Fol. 42rb, l. 6: …ሰላ፡ ለከ፡ በለኒ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ላእከ፡ ማኅፀንትየ፡ ዝንቱ፨ ጊዜ፡ቀዊሞትየ፡ ለለሰዓቱ፨ ቅድመ፡ ወልድ፡ ወወላዲቱ፨ ሰላ፡ ለከ፡ ፈለገ፡ ሰላምነ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ዘመጠነዝ፡ ተከዜ፨ ነዓ፡ ነዓ፡ ዘበበጊዜ፨ ለቡራኬ፡ ወለኑዛዜ፨ እምሕዝብነ፡ ታሰስል፡ እንባዜ፨Fol. 42rb, l. 6: Salutation to you. Announce me, Cyricus, messanger (servant) of this my faith, time of my staying each hour before the son and his procreatress. Salutation to you, valley of our peace, Cyricus who (are) so much as this river. Come, come, anytime, for the blessing and for the confession, so that you might remove the insanity from our people.

listBibl.bibl: EMML no. 303 (20th cent., Church of St. Raphael, quarter of Guläle, ʾAddis ʾAbäba),
EMML no. 486 (late 19th or early 20th, Church of Qirqos, quarter of Boleʾ, ʾAddis ʾAbäba),
fols. 59r-60v: “Greetings [salāmtāt] to St. Cyriacus and his mother Julitta [Iyaluṭṭa]”
EMML no. 3469 (19th cent., Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yäğğu, Wällo),
EMML no. 4816 (1951/2, Church of Däse Mädḫane ˤAläm, Wällo),
fol. 3: "Salām à S. Cyriaque en dix neuf strophes"

msItem.colophon: Fol. 22vb: ወተፈጸመ፡ በዝየ፡ ገድል፡ ወስምዕ፡ ዘቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወዘእሙ፡ ቅድስት፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ጸሎቱ፡ ወበረከቱ፡ የሃሉ፡ ምስለ፡ ፍቁራኒሁ፡ ወልደ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ ወብእሲቱ፡ ወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ወልደ፡ ማርያም፡ ገብረ፡ ሐዋርያ፡ ተወልደ፡ መድኅን፡ ገብረ፡ መድኅን፡ ለዓ፡ ዓ። ወለዘጸሐፎ፡ ወለዘአጽሐፎ፡ ለዘአንበቦ፡ ወለዘተርጐሞ፡ ወለዘሰምዖ፡ ቃላቲሁ፡ ኅቡረ፡ ይምሐሮሙ፡ ለኵሎሙ፡ ደቂቀ፡ ዛቲ፡ መቅደስ፡ ወፈድፋደስ፡ ለፍቁራኒሁ፡ ገብረ፡ ጊዮርጊስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፨Fol. 22vb: Herewith the life and the martyrdom of St. Cyricus and of his mother St. Julitta has been completed; may his prayer and his blessing be with his beloved Wäldä Yoḥannǝs and his wife Wälättä Ṣadqan, Wäldä Maryam, Gäbrä Ḥawarya, Täwäldä Mädḫǝn, Gäbrä Mädḫǝn, for eternity. And for those who wrote it and for those who had it written, for those who read it and for those who translated it and for who listened it, its words, may he have mercy upon all of them, togheter, children of this sanctuary, and especially upon his beloved Gäbrä Giyorgis. For eternity, amen. The date mentioned is the year of mercy 1969 (= 2 January 1976 A.D.)

Fol. 42rb: ተፈጸመ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ አመ፡ ፳ወ፯ለታሕሣሥ፡ በ፲ወ፱፻፷ወ፱ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት፡ ወአጽሐፈቶ፡ ወለተ፡ ጻድቃን፡ ብእሲቱ፡ ለአቶ፡ በላይ፡ ብሩ፡ በ፻ብሩር፡ ወወሀበቶ፡ ለታቦተ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ኡራ፡ ወጸሐፊሁኒ፡ ቂስ፡ ደስታ፡ ገ፡ ማርያም፡ ልጋት፡ ዘሠረቅ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ ውጉዘ፡ይኩን፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጲጥ፡ ወጳ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን፡ ለይ፡ ለይ፨Fol. 42rb: This book is completed on the 27th of the month of Taḥśaś, in the year of mercy 1969; and Wälättä Ṣadqan, the wife of ʾato Bälay Bǝrru, made it be written for 100 Bǝrr, and gave it to the tabot of ʾUra Qirqos. And its scribe is the priest Dästa Gäbrä Maryam (from) Lǝgat. May the one who stole it or erased (the text) be excommunicated with the authority of Peter and Paul. For eternity, amen and amen. Let it be, let it be. The date mentioned is the year of mercy 1969 (= 2 January 1976 A.D.)

supportDesc.extent:
Made of 47.0 folios, of which 7.0 blank fols. 1rv, 2rv, 3rv, 42v, 43rv, 44rv, 45rv., in 7.0 quires (A + 5 + B).
22.7 18.4 4.0

collation.signatures: Decorated - Decorated quire arks are written in the centre of the upper margin: fols. 12r: ፪, 20r: ፫, 28r: ፬, 36r: ፭.

list.item: 8 ፬IV(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 28r-35v)
8 ፭V(8; s.l.: 3, stub after 6; 6, stub after 3/fols. 36r-43v)
2 B(2; s.l.: 1, stub after 1; 2, stub before 1/fols. 44r-45v)

layout.ab: On average, 19 lines; on different folios, from 18 to 22 and 25 lines.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

list.item: - Nine dot asterisk (used throughout the text).
III. Chain of black and red dots (esp. s.: the colophon, fol. 42rb; fol. 22vb, below the text).

handDesc.handNote:
Careful Black; red. Dästa Gäbrä Maryam of LǝgatAccording to colophon 2, the scribe was priest (qes) Dästa Gäbrä Maryam of Lǝgat.20th cent.
Fol. 42ra ls. 11, 15, 19, and fol. 42rb ls. 1, 6, 10:
ሰላ፡ for ሰላም፡
Colophon II, Fol. 42rb: ለዓ፡ ዓ for ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡፡ and other abbreviated names

decoDesc.decoNote: - Fol. 4r: simple, coloured (red, white) ornamental band with two lateral and one central extensions reaching the bottom of the text; geometric motifs.
- Fol. 23ra: two simple, coloured (red, white) ornamental bands separating Text I from Text II; geometric motifs.
- Fol. 37ra: simple, coloured (red, white) ornamental band separating Text II from Text III; geometric motifs.
- Fol. 42rb: simple, coloured (red, white) ornamental band, between the conclusion of Text IV and the colophon; geometric motifs.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover.
Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: triple line fillet, double circle, wave form, cross hatching).

origin.origDate: 27 Taḫśaś 1969 year of mercy (= 2 January 1976 A.D.), s. colophon 2.

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: Wäldä Yoḥannǝs, Wälättä Ṣadǝqan, Wäldä Maryam, Gäbrä Ḥawarya, Täwäldä Mädḫǝn, Gäbrä Mädḫǝn (colophon 1). Wälättä Ṣadǝqan according to colophon 2.
